-- We must assume that errors thrown by test functions are detected. We use
-- the stdlib error() function to signal errors instead of fail().
"assert_true(true, \"A message\" doesn't work!", function() assert_true(true, "A Message"
"assert_true(false, \"A message\" doesn't fail!", function() assert_true(false, "A Message"
"assert_false(false, \"A message\" doesn't work!", function() assert_false(false, "A Message"
"assert_false(true, \"A message\" doesn't fail!", function() assert_false(true, "A Message"
"assert(\"A string\") doesn't work!", function() assert("A string"

-- Traceback function which hides lunit internals
-- Protected call to a function with own traceback
"assert_not_equal", msg, "'%s' not expected but was one"
"assert_match", msg, "expected the pattern as a string but was '%s'"
"assert_match", msg, "expected a string to match pattern '%s' but was '%s'"
"assert_match", msg, "expected '%s' to match pattern '%s' but doesn't"
"assert_not_match", msg, "expected the pattern as a string but was '%s'"
"assert_not_match", msg, "expected a string to not match pattern '%s' but was '%s'"
"assert_not_match", msg, "expected '%s' to not match pattern '%s' but it does"
"assert_error", msg, "expected a function as last argument but was a "
"assert_error", msg, "error expected but no error occurred"
"assert_pass", msg, "expected a function as last argument but was a %s"
"assert_pass", msg, "no error expected but error was: '%s'"
-- Marks a module as a testcase.
-- Applied over a module from module("xyz", lunit.testcase).
-- Register the module as a testcase
-- Import lunit, fail, assert* and is_* function to the module/testcase
-- Finds a function in a testcase case insensitiv
-- Iterator over all test names in a testcase
-- FIXME: Error handling and error messages aren't nice.
